etymology.description: semantic 車 + phonetic 非; simplified 車 → 车.
etymology.interpretation: Combines 車 as the semantic element, hinting at grouping or arrangement, with 非 contributing the sound. The sense developed to mean a class or generation of people, i.e., those grouped together by age or rank.
etymology.simplification: Simplified form of 輩 by component simplification 車 → 车, following the general simplification of the 車 radical/component.

examples.chinese: 作为晚辈，我们应该尊敬长辈(作為晚輩，我們應該尊敬長輩)。
examples.pinyin: Zuòwéi wǎnbèi, wǒmen yīnggāi zūnjìng zhǎngbèi.
examples.english: As juniors, we should respect our elders.

examples.chinese: 他们是同辈，所以说话比较随便(他們是同輩，所以說話比較隨便)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen shì tóngbèi, suǒyǐ shuōhuà bǐjiào suíbiàn.
examples.english: They are peers, so they speak more casually.

examples.chinese: 在这个家族，辈分很严格(在這個家族，輩分很嚴格)。
examples.pinyin: Zài zhège jiāzú, bèifèn hěn yángé.
examples.english: In this family, seniority is strictly observed.
